alert.note: Alert for Chattahoochee; Harris; Heard; Muscogee; Troup (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 1:58PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Muscogee, Chattahoochee, Heard, Troup and Harris Counties through 230 PM EDT... At 157 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from Stroud to near Bartletts Ferry Dam to 6 miles southeast of Fort Mitchell Activity Center, and moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Columbus, LaGrange, Hamilton, Franklin, Cusseta, West Point, Hogansville, Pine Mountain, Centralhatchee, Fort Benning/lawson Army Air Fld, North Fort Benning, Bibb City, Green Island Hills, Cataula, Columbus Metropolitan Airport, Louise, Piedmont Heights, Mountain Hill, Benning Hills and Benning Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
